frqParts.text: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.Crude oil is extracted, transported, and refined for various uses by humans.(a) Describe one environmental impact on marine ecosystems associated with extraction or transportation of crude oil.
(b) Identify an atmospheric pollutant released during the combustion of refined oil products.
(c) Propose a solution an individual can use to reduce their reliance on refined oil products for transportation.
(d) Justify the solution proposed in part (c) by providing a benefit to human health.

Other natural resources, such as gold and silver, are also extracted. These resources can be used to make components for the electronics humans use. One metric ton of gold ore contains <math alttext="5.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn></math> grams of gold.(e) A deposit is estimated to contain <math alttext="260" overflow="scroll"><mn>260</mn></math> million metric tons of gold ore. Calculate the number of grams of gold that could be extracted from the deposit. Show your work.

(f) Assuming the price of gold is <math alttext="$62.56" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$</mtext><mn>62.56</mn></math> per gram, calculate the value of the gold that could be recovered from <math alttext="1,000" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> metric tons of gold ore in the deposit. Show your work.

(g) A typical cell phone contains <math alttext="0.034" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.034</mn></math> grams of gold. Calculate how many metric tons of gold ore would need to be mined to extract enough gold to manufacture <math alttext="100,000" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> cell phones. Show your work.
